page.title: 01Wishford and Stapleford
page.content: Around the villages of Wishford and Stapleford the countryside is rolling and gentle comprising mixed farm land and wooded areas.In Grovely Woods there is a Roman road and the remains of an old hill encampment. {Stapleford}is an attractive little village it lies at the foot of a hill on which can be found the remains of a Norman castle .St.Mary's church was largely built in the 14th century. {Wishford}is a larger village and lies six miles from Salisbury.The name means the ford by the wyche elm.The older part of the village mentioned in the original Domesday Book nestles around St. Giles church where tablets in the church wall record bread prices from 1800.Oak Apple Day,29th May is an important celebration in the village.
